com.googlecode.guicerepository

Class JpaRepositoryModule

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.inject.AbstractModule
      • com.googlecode.guicerepository.JpaRepositoryModule
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.google.inject.Module
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ScanningJpaRepositoryModule

    public abstract class JpaRepositoryModule
extends com.google.inject.AbstractModule
    Guice module with Repository support. Repository bindings should be made in configureRepositories method. Module uses JpaPersistModule from guice-persist, which is requires persistence-unit name as an input parameter. There is three options to specify persistence-unit name:
    1. constructor parameter. For example: new JpaRepositoryModule("my-persistence-unit")
    2. system property 'persistence-unit-name'. For example: launch an application with -Dpersistence-unit-name=my-persistence-unit
    3. override getPersistenceUnitName method. For example: 
                new JpaRepositoryModule(){
               protected String getPersistenceUnitName() {
                    return "my-persistence-unit";
               }
          }
    It is very useful to separate ORM specifics from persistence.xml. This technique gives you possibilities to pack your persistence.xml with mappings/specification-driven aspects to artifact. Module will look for this specifics in ${persistence-unit-name}.properties file placed in the classpath. Also you can define all ORM specifics in persistence.xml, there is no problem with it.
    Author:
    Alexey Krylov AKA lexx

      • getPersistenceUnitProperties

        protected Properties getPersistenceUnitProperties()
        Custom persistence-unit properties - for example it can consist Hibernate/EclipseLink specific parameters. By-default this properties loaded from file named ${persistence-unit-name}.properties located in the classpath.
        Returns:
        initialized java.util.Properties or null.
